Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: BobS
Reviews.Content: Replaced our first LCD TV.  Big, Heavy but the best picture ever!!! Have it attached to a lifting device and it's great viewing for TV and games

Reviews.Title: Just love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Park
Reviews.Content: I researched televisions for like two years before I settled on this LG. I'm glad I did! I love the picture quality. One thing I did not want that I saw on other HD TVs was pixelated images/blurriness in fast moving scenes. Nor did I want pixelated/fuzzy pictures when viewing non-HD content. It's brilliant on both counts! No pixelated images. No blurriness on non-HD content.One thing that I didn't know before I bought it was whether I'd be able to control the brightness. I can, and it's great! One can set it either to adjust automatically to the lighting in the room--an energy saving feature--or set the brightness manually. And bright it is! It's almost blinding if you turn it up all the way. I have a lot of windows in the room and didn't want to have the inconvenience of not being able to see the screen if the sun was shining in.Also, I love free/almost free TV, e.g., broadcast and Netflix. This TV is perfect for that. I can connect it to my laptop with an HDMI cable, and it acts as a second monitor. I can watch whatever I want online right on the big screen. And I didn't have to pay a premium for TV models that are built connect to your wifi on their own and stream only whatever content they are already programmed to stream.
